perturbation.changed_text:
6.2 Acceptance and Rejection of Products.

(a) Promptly following receipt of Product, Magenta shall have the right but not the obligation to test such Product to determine compliance with the Specifications. Magenta shall have 2 days after receipt of the Product to notify Bachem in writing of any rejection of Product based on a sufficiently documented claim that the Product fails to meet the Specifications. In the event that Magenta does not inform Bachem within the 2 days period that the Product does not meet the Specifications, Magenta shall be deemed to have accepted the Product.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the acceptance period to 2 days for pharmaceutical products is commercially unreasonable and potentially violates regulations related to quality control and due diligence in the pharmaceutical industry. It does not provide adequate time for thorough testing and inspection to ensure the product meets specifications and safety standards. This creates a risk of accepting non-conforming or unsafe products. The USPTO requires reasonable testing times for acceptance of products.
perturbation.contradicted_law: United States Pharmacopeia (USP) standards and FDA guidelines related to quality control testing

10. INSURANCE

Bachem shall, during the Initial Term and any Renewal Terms, and [***] after the expiration of the last Product is delivered, obtain and maintain, at its own cost and expense and from a qualified insurance company, comprehensive general liability insurance including, but not limited to, contractual liability coverage and standard product liability coverage in an amount commensurate with industry standards. perturbation.changed_text:
10. INSURANCE

Bachem shall, during the Initial Term only, obtain and maintain, at its own cost and expense and from a qualified insurance company, comprehensive general liability insurance including, but not limited to, contractual liability coverage and standard product liability coverage in an amount commensurate with industry standards. At Magenta's request, Bachem shall provide Magenta with proof of such coverage. Bachem shall provide, and shall cause its Affiliates and sublicensees who perform activities in connection with the manufacture of Product to provide, to Magenta, upon its reasonable request, a statement of coverages, amounts of insurance, and deductibles, and a copy of all policies including clauses within the policies that the insurance company has a duty to defend and indemnify.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires Bachem to maintain insurance coverage during the Initial Term, any Renewal Terms, and for a period after the expiration of the last Product is delivered ([***] is confidential, but should last the appropriate duration to protect the end consumer). By removing the requirement to maintain insurance after the Initial Term, the change contradicts basic risk management principles and may violate laws related to product liability. Manufacturers are generally expected to maintain insurance coverage for a reasonable period after product delivery to cover potential claims arising from defects or injuries, even after the contract has ended. It weakens product liability coverage.
